trans-unit.source: Specifies the appearance of a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawingAttributes%2A> property to specify settings such as color, width, transparency, and the shape of the stylus tip for a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.DefaultDrawingAttributes%2A> property to specify the drawing attributes for the strokes added to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
Only strokes that are added after the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.DefaultDrawingAttributes%2A> undergo change show the updated attributes.
The appearance of the strokes that are already on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> does not change.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> class, see the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> constructor.
XAML Text Usage
This class is not typically used in XAML.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> class.
Property
Initial Value
Black
2 device independent pixels (DIP)
2 DIP
Adds a custom property to the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.AddPropertyData%2A> method enables you to add custom properties to a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> object.
This is useful when you render your own strokes and want to provide extra information.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> to associate with the custom property.
The value of the custom property.
propertyData must be of type , , , , , , , , , , , , , or an array of these data types; however it cannot be an array of type .
propertyData is `null`.
propertyDataId is an empty .
-or-
propertyData is not one of the allowed data types listed in the `Parameters` section.
Occurs when a property in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object changes.
Copies the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Clone%2A> method creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> object and populates it with the same values as the current object.
Any custom properties are also copied.
A copy of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the color of a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
XAML Text Usage
This property is not typically used in XAML.
The color of a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified property data identifier is in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object .
`true` if the specified property data identifier is in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object.
Two <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> objects are equal if the following properties are equal:
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Equals%2A> method does not check the custom properties for equality.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object to compare to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object.
`true` if the objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether Bezier smoothing is used to render the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
XAML Text Usage
This property is not typically used in XAML.
`true` to use Bezier smoothing to render the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>; otherwise `false`.
The default is `false`.
Serves as a hash function for a particular type.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Gets the value of the custom property associated with the specified <xref href="System.Guid"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.GetPropertyData%2A> method to access custom properties you added to a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> object.
<xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.GetPropertyData%2A> returns the default value for the built-in property if a value has not been set.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> associated with the custom property to get.
The value of the custom property associated with the specified <xref href="System.Guid"></xref>.
propertyDataId is not associated with a custom property of the object.
Returns the GUIDs of any custom properties associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
The GUIDs for the built-in properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> class are in the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributeIds> class.
An array of type <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> that represents the property data identifiers.
Gets or sets the height of the stylus used to draw the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
The following factors affect the height and width of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> when it is rendered, but not the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Height%2A> property.
The amount of pressure applied to the stylus when the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> is drawn.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.StylusTipTransform%2A> property.
If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Height%2A> property to 0 device independent pixels (DIP), it is changed to 2 DIP.
XAML Text Usage
This property is not typically used in XAML.
The value that indicates the height of the stylus used to draw the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Height"></xref> property is less than <xref href="System.Double.Epsilon"></xref> or <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the thickness of a rendered <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> changes according the amount of pressure applied.
XAML Text Usage
This property is not typically used in XAML.

`true` to indicate that the thickness of the stroke is uniform; `false` to indicate that the thickness of a rendered <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> increases when pressure is increased.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> looks like a highlighter.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.IsHighlighter%2A> property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> is slightly transparent, which allows the strokes underneath to appear.
XAML Text Usage
This property is not typically used in XAML.
`true` to render the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> as a highlighter; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Specifies the largest value allowed for the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Height"></xref> property.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.MaxHeight> field to check whether a value is within the limits allowed for the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Height%2A> property.
Do this when the value comes from an unknown source, such as unconstrained user input.
Specifies the largest value allowed for the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width"></xref> property.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.MaxWidth> field to check whether a value is within the limits allowed for the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width%2A> property.
Do this when the value comes from an unknown source, such as unconstrained user input.
Specifies the smallest value allowed for the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Height"></xref> property.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.MinHeight> field to check whether a value is within the limits allowed for the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Height%2A> property.
Do this when the value comes from an unknown source, such as unconstrained user input.
Specifies the smallest value allowed for the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width"></xref> property.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.MinWidth> field to check whether a value is within the limits allowed for the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width%2A> property.
Do this when the value comes from an unknown source, such as unconstrained user input.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.AttributeChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.OnAttributeChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
e is `null`.
Occurs when any <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> property changes.
EventArgs
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.PropertyDataChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.OnPropertyDataChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
e is `null`.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> objects are equal.
Two <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> objects are equal if the following properties are equal:
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.op_Equality%2A> method does not check the custom properties for equality.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object to compare.
`true` if the objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> objects are not equal.
Two <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes> objects are not equal if the following properties are not equal:
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.op_Inequality%2A> method does not check the custom properties for equality.
The equivalent method for this operator is the negation of <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes"></xref> object to compare.
`true` if the objects are not equal; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when property data is added or removed from the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
Removes the custom property associated with the specified <xref href="System.Guid"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> associated with the custom property to remove.
propertyDataId is not associated with a custom property of the object.
Gets or sets the shape of the stylus used to draw the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
XAML Text Usage
This property is not typically used in XAML.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> that specifies the transformation to perform on the stylus' tip.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.StylusTipTransform%2A> property to rotate, skew, or scale the stylus tip.
XAML Text Usage
This property is not typically used in XAML.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> that specifies the transformation to perform on the stylus' tip.
The matrix set to <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.StylusTipTransform"></xref> is not an invertible matrix.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY"></xref> property of the matrix is not zero.
Gets or sets the width of the stylus used to draw the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
The following factors affect the height and width of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> when it is rendered, but not the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width%2A> property.
The amount of pressure applied to the stylus when the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> is drawn.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.StylusTipTransform%2A> property.
If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width%2A> property to 0 device independent pixels (DIP), it is changed to 2 DIP.
XAML Text Usage
This property is not typically used in XAML.
The width of the stylus used to draw the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width"></xref> property is less than <xref href="System.Double.Epsilon"></xref> or <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>.
